name: swig-napi-example-project
description: Example template for using SWIG Node-API for a dual-build Node.js/native + Browser/WASM project

scripts.swig: mkdir -p build && swig-jse -javascript -napi -typescript -c++ -outdir build -exports '../build/Release/example.node' -o build/example_wrap.cc src/example.i
scripts.swig:debug: mkdir -p build && swig-jse -javascript -napi -typescript -c++ -outdir build -exports '../build/Debug/example.node' -o build/example_wrap.cc src/example.i
scripts.test: npm run test:nodejs && npm run test:browser
scripts.test:browser: cd test/browser && npx webpack --mode=production && npx karma start ./karma.conf.cjs
scripts.build:wasm: CC=emcc CXX=em++ npx node-gyp configure build --target_platform=emscripten
scripts.build: npm run build:native && npm run build:wasm
scripts.prepare: node -e "console.log('\x1b[32m', 'Run \"npm run swig\" to generate the wrappers', '\x1b[0m');"
scripts.install: node -e "console.log('\x1b[32m', 'Run \"npm run build\", \"npm run build:native\" or \"npm run build:wasm\" to build', '\x1b[0m');"

author: Momtchil Momtchev <momtchil@momtchev.com>
